title: C# .NET, WPF desktop application
description: As a C# .NET WPF developer, we are expecting a combination of technical skills, experience, and knowledge to develop our applications. Here's a list of requirements typically expected of our developer: Proficiency in C#: Strong understanding and experience with the C# programming language, including its features, syntax, and best practices. Experience with .NET Framework or .NET Core: Knowledge of the .NET framework or .NET Core, including familiarity with common libraries, frameworks, and tools provided by Microsoft. WPF Fundamentals: Deep understanding of Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) concepts, including XAML (eXtensible Application Markup Language), data binding, styles, templates, resources, and controls. MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) Architecture: Proficiency in implementing the MVVM design pattern for separating concerns in WPF applications, including the use of data binding and commands to achieve loose coupling between components. UI/UX Design Principles: Understanding of user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design principles, including layout design, usability, accessibility, and responsiveness. XAML Markup Language: Strong knowledge of XAML markup language for defining user interfaces and layouts in WPF applications. Data Binding: Experience with data binding techniques to connect UI elements to data sources, including binding to objects, collections, and dependency properties. Asynchronous Programming: Proficiency in asynchronous programming techniques using async/await keywords to handle long-running operations without blocking the UI thread. Debugging and Testing: Ability to debug and test WPF applications effectively using Visual Studio or other debugging tools, including unit testing frameworks such as NUnit or MSTest. Problem-Solving Skills: Strong problem-solving skills to troubleshoot issues, optimize application performance, and implement efficient solutions.
